title: Synthetic Recap
body:
PHOENIX (AP) – In a defensive war of attrition, where points were forged in fire and every possession was a battle, Alonzo Mourning authored a performance for the ages. The Miami Heat center was an immovable force, carrying his team to a grueling 87-84 victory over the Phoenix Suns on the strength of a career-high 41 points.

The game was a symphony of grit, but Mourning was the thunderous soloist. While others struggled to find their rhythm, ‘Zo was a model of brutal efficiency, dominating the painted area against a relentless Suns frontcourt. His 41 points weren't just a number; they were the foundation upon which the Heat built their entire offense, a necessary counterpunch to every Suns rally.

Phoenix, led by the sharpshooting of Wesley Person who drained five three-pointers for his 23 points, refused to wilt. Kevin Johnson orchestrated the attack with 13 assists, probing and pushing to find cracks in Miami’s armor. But every time the Suns drew close, the answer was invariably Mourning—a powerful post move, a put-back dunk, or a trip to the foul line where he converted 11 of his 13 attempts.

The final score reflects a game where both teams shot under 42 percent, a testament to the defensive intensity. Yet, amidst the collective struggle, one man rose above. On a night where points were a premium, Alonzo Mourning delivered a king’s ransom, scoring nearly half of his team’s total and etching his name into the ledger of legendary individual performances.
